We are driving toward the parallel goals of growing a dynamic and forward-thinking company while creating a positive impact on our environment. Our company is filled with smart and innovative thinkers and doers, and we never stop striving to improve our technology, to expand and improve our company performance, and to develop and support the many talented employees that serve our mission.

We are looking for a Project Engineer, Korea to join our team in one of today\u2019s most exciting technologies and this role will be based in Seoul - Korea.

Additional Comments

The Project Engineer primarily will work with Program Manager and Senior Project Engineer responsible for overseeing project completions from initial pre-construction stages to commercial operation stages in multiple projects in Korea. The Project Engineer must have a strong understanding of a broad set of engineering and construction solutions and have the ability to manage the internal and external project development process and schedules.

Job responsibilities include supporting/handling project management, site supervisions with HQ teams; interface with local government officials and utilities; managing field service personnel; and managing customer relationships. Knowledge of construction, electrical, mechanical, and electro-chemical applications is essential.

Role And Responsibilities
  • Partner with US HQ team to execute Korea focused programs and projects including maintaining awareness of US design and development activities
  • Support the development of the Korea program delivery strategy and assist Korea in-country team members in support of key deployments
  • Broadly support regional business development initiatives
  • Bridge Bloom Energy\u2019s global management approach with regional expertise
  • Project and business operations budget and site construction/installation schedule creation and execution
  • Construction, installation, and project close-out documentation completion to meet all technical and governmental standards
  • Regulatory outreach and permit requirement acquisition and documentation
  • Gas and electrical utility interconnection process
  • Construction bid documents development
  • Project commissioning
  • Regularly interface with internal Bloom Energy cross functional resources and subject matter experts
  • Contribute to the success of Bloom Energy\u2019s long-term process improvement efforts
  • Ensure exemplary safety and performance through specific metrics during site construction and commissioning
  • Ensure that Bloom Energy customers are 100% satisfied with the product and their site energy solution installation experience
  • Deliver presentations confidently to all project stakeholders

Education, Skills And Experience
  • Engineering degree in relevant discipline.
  • Experience working in Korea as well as abroad (US preferred)
  • 4 to 6 plus years of relevant experience in power generation, chemical/petro-chemical plant, or fuel cell applications.
  • Extremely professional in terms of appearance, phone manner, and group presentation skills.
  • Proactive and persistent with well-developed analytical skills. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills that include a minimum of the following:
    • Ability to communicate complex technical concepts in a clear, concise manner for a non-technical audience.
    • Ability to interact with all levels of an organization effectively, from facilities personnel to financial leadership.
    • Ability to confidently and clearly defend technical recommendations utilizing sound industry standards and referencing past performance. Self-starter that shows the ability to work independently and under minimal supervision.
  • Construction and/or Facility maintenance experience a plus.
  • Project engineer experience in power generation or chemical plant\u2019s construction a plus
  • Experience in using Microsoft Office and Hangul products.
  • Fluent in Korean with Advanced English language capabilities
  • 3+ years of project management experience including 2+ years of power generation and/or chemical industry experience strongly preferred. Candidate experience must include management of multiple, schedule constraints, large capital projects with multiple contractors
  • Renewable energy experience at scales less than 100mw is strongly preferred; project experience in South Korea in fuel cells is a plus.
  • Project management experience should include management of budgets, schedules, design contracts, and construction contracts
  • Experience producing results with gas and electrical utilities and leading local permitting efforts is strongly preferred
  • Familiarity with building/mechanical/electrical safety codes in Korea highly favorable: KESCO and KOSHA regulations a plus
  • Demonstrated experience managing cross-functional teams of subject matter experts strongly preferred
  • B.S. Engineering: Chemical, Electrical, Control & Measurement and/or Mechanical Engineering strongly preferred though other technical degrees (Construction Management, Electrical, Architecture, etc.) will be considered.
  • Advanced experience of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) and Hangul is strongly preferred

About Bloom Energy

At Bloom Energy, we strive toward a 100% renewable future. Our Energy Servers are adaptable to new and innovative fuels while already acting as a cleaner and far more resilient source of power than existing solutions. We see hydrogen as a significant game-changer in the world\u2019s energy usage, and Bloom Energy fuel cells and electrolyzers will be the industry standard for clean, efficient, and reliable energy production. We anticipate being able to work in concert with other renewable energy technologies to create a comprehensive system that will change the way energy in the world is produced, stored, transmitted, and used. For more information visit: www.bloomenergy.com.

Bloom Energy is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We are committed to compliance with all applicable laws providing equal employment opportunities. All qualified applicants, will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. Bloom Energy makes reasonable accommodations, consistent with applicable laws, for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified applicant or employee with a disability, who can perform the essential job functions, unless undue hardship would result."}
